metadata.Title: CVE-2021-27922 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Pillow before 8.1.1 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memoryconsumption) because the reported size of a contained image is not properlychecked for an ICNS container, and thus an attempted memory allocation canbe very large.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-27922` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-pil - 5.1.0-1ubuntu0.5
python-pil.imagetk - 5.1.0-1ubuntu0.5
python3-pil - 5.1.0-1ubuntu0.5
python3-pil.imagetk - 5.1.0-1ubuntu0.5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: pillow package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.1.0-1ubuntu0.5').
